node.title: No Taylor test retirement u-turn after Australian ODI postponement
node.description: NZ Cricket boss David White says Taylor won't be available to face South Africa next month.
node.content: ["Blackcaps batter Ross Taylor won't reverse his retirement from test cricket after the postponement of New Zealand's white ball tour of Australia, NZ Cricket boss David White says.", "Taylor called time on his test career last week, finishing up as a red ball cricketer after the two-test series against Bangladesh.", "As New Zealand's leading test run scorer, Taylor's final act in whites saw him seal the Blackcaps' victory as a bowler, taking the final wicket to level the two-test series with victory by an innings and 117 runs in Christchurch.", "After originally planning to end his career with white ball series against Australia and the Netherlands, Wednesday's announcement had freed up Taylor's schedule for another potential test tilt.", "The scheduling of the Australian tour initially meant that none of the Blackcaps' test players would be involved, with not enough time for players to quarantine before the two-test series against South Africa next month.", "But despite the postponement now freeing up New Zealand's white ball specialists for the immediate future, Taylor won't be available for the test side to face the Proteas, NZC chief executive White says.", "\"No he's not, he's played his last test,\" White tells Newshub.", "\"His last act was getting that test wicket, I know he's really looking forward to playing against the Netherlands.", "\"We'll farewell him in an appropriate way in Hamilton against the Netherlands.\"", "Appearing in the series against South Africa could have allowed for the perfect end to Taylor's test career.", "In eight tests against the Proteas, Taylor has never reached triple figures, with his best score being just 48 not out.", "Taylor has scored just 233 runs at an average of 25.88 against South Africa, considerably down on his career average of 44.66.", "A century against South Africa would also have seen Taylor become only the second New Zealander after Kane Williamson to score hundreds against every other test playing nation - barring Ireland and Afghanistan, who the Blackcaps have never faced.", "What's more, South Africa are the only side New Zealand's men are yet to win a test series against, with this summer representing arguably their best chance after becoming World Test Champions in 2021.", "Instead, Taylor will end his career with a three match one day international series against Associate Nation the Netherlands.", "The Blackcaps will meet the Netherlands in Dunedin on March 29, and Hamilton on April 2 and 4."]
